title: GameStop, Other Meme Stocks Leap Premarket
sub_head: Videogame retailer’s stock is still well below its intraday peak of $483 in late January
body:
GameStop Corp. shares soared in premarket trade, in a rally reminiscent of last month’s blockbuster gains.
Shares of the videogame retailer surged more than 75% in off hours trading Thursday. GameStop finished 104% higher Wednesday at $91.71, after being halted twice for volatility. Options activity tied to GameStop also hit the highest level in two weeks, with bullish contracts significantly outpacing bearish ones, Trade Alert data show.
A clear catalyst for the surge couldn’t be determined. The company said after markets closed Tuesday that its chief financial officer would resign March 26.
Other “meme” stocks—ones that are popular on Reddit’s WallStreetBets forum—also jumped in offhours trading. AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. climbed almost 15% premarket, after finishing Wednesday 18% higher. Headphone-maker Koss Corp. surged almost 100% early Thursday.
Both stocks, and several others, saw their share prices rapidly rise in January during GameStop’s meteoric ascent. They have fallen in the weeks since.
